title: Honey on Wounds (2014)
overview: During the Kosovo War thousands of Albanian women were held hostage by Serbian troops, tortured and forced to witness the execution of their husbands. According to the old law of Kanun war widows in Kosovo are forbidden to remarry, work or lead an independent life outside of their homes. Held back by tradition they are now fighting depression and poverty. In a small village of widows, counsellors are trying to convince the women that the healing journey can start right in their garden. All they need is a wooden box and a queen bee.
storyline: During the Kosovo War thousands of Albanian women witnessed the execution of their husbands. They are now forbidden to remarry, or lead independent lives. In a village of widows, they are being shown a sweet way to start the healing journey.
